author: detroitnews.com
title: Warford, Ngata miss Lions practice
text:
Larry Warford might not be protecting Matthew Stafford on Sunday. (Photo: Daniel Mears, Detroit News) 
CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Allen Park â€” Lions right guard Larry Warford missed practice Thursday, which is potentially bad news for an offensive line hoping to show improvement against the Arizona Cardinals on Sunday.
Warford aggravated his ankle injury in Week 3 and missed much of the game. He practiced fully on Thursday and Friday last week, but after being limited Saturday, he missed Week 4. Now, after being limited Wednesday and sitting Thursday, there's a chance he'll miss another game.
In addition to Warford, Lions defensive tackle Haloti Ngata (calf) missed practice Thursday, and after the Lions signed another defensive tackle Thursday, Ishmaa'ily Kitchen, there's reason to think he's in danger of sitting.
Linebacker Travis Lewis (ankle), running back Joique Bell (ankle) and tight end Eric Ebron (knee) were also out.
The Lions will release an injury report later Thursday listing the players who were limited.
